intro: Citharexylum matudae, commonly known as the Matudae cithara, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, small leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
